summary:
Gangrene is when body tissue dies due to poor blood flow. It often affects hands and feet. Symptoms include skin color changes, numbness, and pain. It can be caused by various factors like diabetes, smoking, or injuries. There are different types, such as dry, wet, and gas gangrene.

Doctors diagnose it by symptoms and tests. Treatment involves removing dead tissue, antibiotics, and addressing the cause. This might include surgery, medication, or procedures to improve blood flow. Quick treatment is essential to prevent further damage.
title: Gangrene
